meanings.definition: Public condemnation or criticism of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The denunciation of the unfair treatment sparked a public outcry.
meanings.sent2: The denunciation of the corrupt politician was heard by many.
meanings.sent3: The denunciation of the spoiled dessert at the party caused a stir.
meanings.sent4: Her denunciation of the toxic relationship was a weight off her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The denunciation of the criminal's actions was clear and powerful.

meanings.definition: The action of informing against someone.
meanings.sent1: His denunciation of the thief led to the recovery of stolen goods.
meanings.sent2: The denunciation of the cheating student was necessary to maintain fairness.
meanings.sent3: The denunciation of the missing cookies pointed directly at the culprit.
meanings.sent4: Her denunciation of the bully's behavior brought peace to the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The denunciation of the illegal activity was a brave act of honesty.

meanings.definition: A formal announcement of the termination of a treaty or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The denunciation of the trade agreement caused tension between the countries.
meanings.sent2: The denunciation of the alliance was met with disappointment by many.
meanings.sent3: The denunciation of the lunchtime pact left everyone hungry and confused.
meanings.sent4: His denunciation of the ceasefire shook the foundation of peace talks.
meanings.sent5: The denunciation of the partnership was met with mixed reactions.
